Paul Manafort getting such little jail time for such serious crimes lays out for the world how it’s almost impossible for rich people to go to jail for the same amount of time as someone who is lower income.

In our current broken system, “justice” isn’t blind. It’s bought. https://twitter.com/arimelber/status/1103812490654302208 QT @AriMelber Paul Manafort’s lenient 4-year sentence — far below the recommended 20 years despite extensive felonies and post-conviction obstruction — is a reminder of the blatant inequities in our justice system that we all know about, because they reoccur every week in courts across America

This bill is revolutionary b/c it's created #ForThePeople -- Not 👏🏿Special  👏🏿Interests👏🏿

The United States has:
5% of the world's population
21% of the world's prisoners.

Imagine what we could accomplish if we invested in education instead of spending $80 billion a year to lock up 2.2 million people.

Deuteronomy 30:19-20

RT @STHGibbs Venezuela in midst of its most prolonged and widespread powercut in living memory. Entire city of Caracas in darkness. Many hospitals and clinics without functioning generators. Grave concern as to what the effect of this will be on the most vulnerable.

The Next Step Act would reduce harsh mandatory minimums for nonviolent drug offenses: the 20-year mandatory minimum would be reduced to 10 years, the 10-year mandatory minimum would be reduced to 5 years, and the 5-year mandatory minimum would be reduced to 2 years.

My incredible Chief Counsel Tona Boyd is on her way right now to the Senate floor to officially introduce my new criminal justice reform bill: the Next Step Act! http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D1EgENIWsAAvppz.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D1EgEN-WoAEft0j.jpg

Thank you, @SherrodBrown, for everything you’ve done to bring attention to the dignity of work and your unyielding fight for workers’ rights. Ohioans and Americans across this country are lucky to have you fighting for us. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D1FADXGWoAMgbHC.jpg
